head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 13 distinct parts:

head.note: This manuscript contains: Theodore of Mopsuestia. Fragments of the treatise of Theodore of Mopsuestia on the Incarnation of our Lord, divided into 15 booksThe Greek title seems to have been Περὶ ἐνανθρωπήσεως τοῦ ὑιοῦ τοῦ Θεοῦ λόγοι ιεʹ; that of the Syriac translation was, perhaps, ܡܛܠ ܦܓܪܢܘܬܗ ܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 1 distinct parts:
This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

head.note: The division of this manuscript into codicological units differs from that of Wright's catalogue. Some parts of this manuscript may not have been differentiated by Wright.

msItem.author: Theodore of Mopsuestia
msItem.title: Fragments of the treatise of Theodore of Mopsuestia on the Incarnation of our Lord, divided into 15 booksThe Greek title seems to have been Περὶ ἐνανθρωπήσεως τοῦ ὑιοῦ τοῦ Θεοῦ λόγοι ιεʹ; that of the Syriac translation was, perhaps, ܡܛܠ ܦܓܪܢܘܬܗ ܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ.
msItem.note: See O. F. Fritzsche, de Theodori Mopsuesteni vita et scriptis commentatio (Halae, 1836), p. 88; Migne, Patrol. Gr., t. lxvi., col. 55; Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. iii., pars 1., p. 33; Cave, Hist. Liter., t. i., p. 387.

Whether the leaves, as now arranged, are in correct sequence, is very uncertain. The 43d section, ܡܓ, begins on fol. 4 b; and the 6th discourse ends on fol. 6 b, with the subscription ܫܠܡ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܐܫܬܐ . The 50th section, ܢܢ, commences on fol. 7 b. On fol. 10 b we find the conclusion of the 8th discourse and the commencement of the 9th, comprising sections ܣܓ, ܣܕ, and ܣܗ, which have been subsequently altered into ܣܕ, ܣܗ, and ܣܘ. The 10th discourse ends, and the 11th begins, on fol. 11 b. On fol. 12 b there is also the running title ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܚܕܥܣܪ
. The 78th and 79th sections appear on fol. 17 b.
These fragments have been edited, with a Latin translation, by Dr. Sachau, in "Theodori Mopsuesteni Fragmenta Syriaca," Leipzig, 1869

physDesc.p: Eighteen vellum leaves, about 10 3/4 in. by 8 3/8, nearly all more or less stained, torn, and mutilated. The quires are signed with letters (fol. 6 b, ܛ). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 34 to 37 lines. The writing is a small, elegant, Edessene Estrangělā, of the vth or vith cent.

item.p:
Eighteen vellum leaves, about 10 3/4 in. by 8 3/8, nearly all more or less stained, torn, and mutilated. The quires are signed with letters (fol. 6 b, ܛ). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 34 to 37 lines. Fol. 8
has been used in binding a volume of the discourses of Jacob of Batnae. Note to Readers: This manuscript has a complex transmission history. The database structure is not able to model that complexity in this description.
On fol. 11 b there is written, in a still more modern hand, the name of one John of Damascus,

p.quote: ܝܘܚܢܢ ܕܕܰܪܡܣܩܳܝܐ (sic) ܒܨܝܪܐ ܘܚܛܝܐ ܏ܚܪ ܢ̇ܬ݁݀ܠܢ (sic) ܠܗ ܘܝܐ ܡܛܠ ܐܠܗܐ ܨܠܘ ܥܠܘܗܝ

msItem.quote: ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܕܥܠ ܗܘܫܥ܀ ܘܥܠ ܛܘܦܢܐ܀ ܥܠ ܐܒܘܢ ܕܒܫܡܝܐ܀ ܘܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܪܐ ܕܦܪܚ ܢܟ̈ܣܘܗܝ܀ ܕܥܠ ܥܣܪ̈ ܒܬܘܠܘܬܐ (sic) ܀ ܕܥܠ ܡܫܬܘܬܐ܀ ܕܥܠ ܡܚܬܗ(sic) ܕܡܪܢ܀ ܕܥܠ ܩܛܢܐ ܕܡܕܝܢܬܐ܀ ܕܥܠ ܪ̈ܘܝܐ܀ ܕܥܠ ܣܝܘܡܐ ܕܢܡܘܣܐ܀

physDesc.p: Vellum leaf. This folio has been used in binding a volume of the discourses of Jacob of Batnae and is now part of Add. 14,669, foll. 1-18 .

item.p: Vellum leaf. This folio has been used in binding a volume of the discourses of Jacob of Batnae and is now part of Add. 14,669, foll. 1-18 .

msItem.title: The Gospel of S. Matthew, according to the Peshitta version

physDesc.p: A vellum leaf, 10 ¾ in. by 8 ¼ , slightly torn. It is written in double columns, in an inelegant Estrangela of about the xiith cent.

item.p: This leaf appears to be palimpsest, but the more ancient writing has been wholly effaced.
Therectohas, when in a damp state, taken an impression from a leaf of a much older manuscript.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The four Gospels, according to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 5 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The four Gospels, according to the Peshitta version
The Gospel of Matthew
The Gospel of Mark
The Gospel of Luke
The Gospel of John

physDesc.p: Nineteen vellum leaves, about 11 in. by 8, most of which are more or less stained and torn (Add. 14,669, foll. 38—56). The quires were signed with letters (fol. 51 a, ܘ). There are from 35 to 41 lines in each page. The writing is a good, regular, Nestorian Estrangela, with occasional Syriac vowels and other marks, of about the ixth cent.

collation.p: The quires were signed with letters (fol. 51 a,ܘ).

item.p: Most of the leaves are more or less stained and torn.

layout.p: There are from 35 to 41 lines in each page.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script
